title: 1001 Nuggets
description: 1001 Nuggets is a MERN app that stores quotes, authors, and topics in a large database. This app was made as a continuation of the Proverbial Wisdom project, as a sort of "second, more professionally designed" attempt at a similar idea.

title: Proverbial Wisdom
description: Proverbial Wisdom is a MERN app that functions as a database of proverbs from miscellanenous cultures. This app was made after completion of my UNH bootcamp course, as a test of my personal MERN skills.

title: Group Project: Monster Battle
description: Monster Battle was the final group project I had worked on during the UNH bootcamp; a browser based video game. It proved to be too ambitious for our time frame, but I'm still proud to show off the functional login system and other back-end features I had worked on.

title: Group Project: SWOSAAT
description: SWOSAAT is a group project I participated in during my time in the UNH fullstack bootcamp. It's an acronym that stands for "Saving the World, One Subscription At A Time". The academic goals of the app were to show our ability to program a Node.js app with SQL as its database, Express.js for routing, Handlebars.js for a stylistic engine, and a functional login system.

title: TS 10: Team Profile Generator
description: The Team Profile Generator is a console-based application that generates a basic HTML page for the user based on a series of prompts, detailing their production team based on the roles of "manager", "engineer", and "intern".

title: TS 09: ReadMe Generator
description: This project is a console-based readme generator, made to test my proficiency with the inquirer npm package, as well as serving as an introduction into Node.js based apps.

title: Group Project: DareDEVils
description: DareDEVils is a group project from the UNH bootcamp. My job during this process was to handle the javascript; the project makes calls to APIs for a Marvel database and a movie database called OMDB, and displays the fetched information for the user.

title: TS 06: Weather API Fetch
description: The Weather API fetch is an html-js-css hybrid project that asks for an input in the form of a major city name, and uses it to call a weather API to show a 5-day weather forecast of that area. This UNH project tests one's skills with API calls, user inputs, and one's aptitude with local storage (via the user input history).

title: TS 05: Event Planner
description: The Event Planner is an html-js-css hybrid project that allows the user to plan events throughout an 8 hour work day. This UNH project was intended as an assessment of one's skills with jquery, API fetching, and working with the "Date" datatype.

title: TS 04: Quiz Generator With Timer
description: The quiz generator is a simple assignment from the UNH bootcamp designed to test our aptitude with local storage. It also has a timer that counts down using setInterval.

title: TS 02: Advanced CSS Demo
description: An assignment from the UNH bootcamp, this project involved heavy CSS work to create a visually pleasing page without using any framework. This project served as a template for my original portfolio.

title: TS 01: Code Refactor
description: Code Refactor is the first assignment issued by the UNH bootcamp; it serves as a test of basic knowledge with HTML and CSS. The goal was to recreate a picture of a static HTML page using only semantic tags and CSS, no frameworks or javascript.
